B2 the quality of being honest: I appreciate your honesty.in all honesty I must tell you in all honesty (= truthfully and hiding nothing) that there is little chance of the proposal being approved.
More examplesFewer examplesShe spoke with brutal honesty - I was too old for the job.He should be praised for his honesty.And the moral of the story is that honesty is always the best policy.I have no reason to doubt her honesty, it's just that I can't understand how it happened.Well, I don't want to offend anyone but, in all honesty, I do have some criticisms to make.

honesty noun [U]
(PLANT)
a plant with purple or white flowers whose seeds are contained in discs that become transparent as they dry out: Honesty produces silvery, moon-like seed heads. Perennial honesty is an exceptionally beautiful plant.
